intro: Stenogyne bifida, commonly known as the Hawaiian honeyflower, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its opposite, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, fragrant flowers that range in color from white to pink. Stenogyne bifida is often found growing in moist, shaded areas of tropical forests. Its unique floral structure and ecological importance make it a notable species in Hawaiian botany.
